com.yworks.yfiles.layout.router.polyline

Class EdgeLayoutDescriptor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yworks.yfiles.layout.router.polyline.EdgeLayoutDescriptor

  • public class EdgeLayoutDescriptor
extends Object
    This class is used by EdgeRouter to provide routing details for the edges of the graph.

    An EdgeLayoutDescriptor instance can be specified individually for single edges using a IDataProvider that returns an EdgeLayoutDescriptor instance for each edge of the graph, or null if no EdgeLayoutDescriptor is bound to an edge. The IDataProvider is registered with the graph using key EdgeRouter.EDGE_LAYOUT_DESCRIPTOR_DPKEY.

    This class is designed such that it allows future additions of new getter methods.

     
    Not all of the values contained in this class will be considered for all kinds of edges and algorithm settings.
    See Also:
    EdgeRouter.EDGE_LAYOUT_DESCRIPTOR_DPKEY

    • Method Detail

      • createCopy

        public EdgeLayoutDescriptor createCopy()
        Creates a copy of this EdgeLayoutDescriptor instance.
        Returns:
        a copy of this EdgeLayoutDescriptor instance

      • getMinimumEdgeToEdgeDistance

        public double getMinimumEdgeToEdgeDistance()
        Gets the minimum distance between a pair of edges.

        The minimum distance should be greater than or equal to 0. If a negative value is given as input, the default value, i.e., 3.0, will be used instead.

        Default Value:
        The default value is 3.0.
        Returns:
        the minimum distance between a pair of edges
        See Also:
        setMinimumEdgeToEdgeDistance(double)

      • getMinimumFirstSegmentLength

        public double getMinimumFirstSegmentLength()
        Gets the minimum length of the first segment of the edge path (at the source node).

        The minimum length should be greater than or equal to 0. If a negative value is given as input, the default value, i.e., 5.0, will be used instead.

         
        The final segment length also depends on the used grid size (see Spacing). If the grid is larger than the specified minimum length, then the grid size defines the actual minimum.
        Default Value:
        The default value is 5.0.
        Returns:
        the minimum length of the first segment
        See Also:
        setMinimumFirstSegmentLength(double)

      • getMinimumLastSegmentLength

        public double getMinimumLastSegmentLength()
        Gets the minimum length of the last segment of the edge path (at the target node).

        The minimum length should be greater than or equal to 0. If a negative value is given as input, the default value, i.e., 10.0, will be used instead.

         
        The final segment length also depends on the used grid size (see Spacing). If the grid is larger than the specified minimum length, then the grid size defines the actual minimum.
        Default Value:
        The default value is 10.0.
        Returns:
        the minimum length of the last segment
        See Also:
        setMinimumLastSegmentLength(double)

      • getMinimumNodeCornerDistance

        public double getMinimumNodeCornerDistance()
        Gets the minimum distance that the edge should maintain from node corners when entering or leaving the node.

        The minimum distance should be greater than or equal to 0. If a negative value is given as input, the default value, i.e., 3.0, will be used instead.

        Default Value:
        The default value is 3.0.
        Returns:
        the minimum distance the edge should maintain from node corners
        See Also:
        setMinimumNodeCornerDistance(double)

      • getMonotonicPathRestriction

        public MonotonicPathRestriction getMonotonicPathRestriction()
        Gets the monotonic path restrictions that should be applied.

        Monotonic path restrictions imply that (ideally) the vertical and/or horizontal segments of an edge path are directed from the source node towards the target node without ever changing their direction back towards the source node.

        If an unknown restriction is specified, MonotonicPathRestriction.NONE will be used instead.

        Default Value:
        The default value is MonotonicPathRestriction.NONE. No path restrictions are used.
        Returns:
        one of the predefined monotonic path restrictions
        See Also:
        setMonotonicPathRestriction(MonotonicPathRestriction)

      • getPenaltySettings

        public PenaltySettings getPenaltySettings()
        Gets the PenaltySettings used for this edge.

        Besides specifying a completely customized setting, the user can choose between four predefined optimization strategies: PenaltySettings.OPTIMIZATION_BALANCED, PenaltySettings.OPTIMIZATION_EDGE_BENDS, PenaltySettings.OPTIMIZATION_EDGE_CROSSINGS and PenaltySettings.OPTIMIZATION_EDGE_LENGTHS.

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given penalty settings are null
        Returns:
        the penalty settings used for this edge
        See Also:
        PenaltySettings.OPTIMIZATION_BALANCED, PenaltySettings.OPTIMIZATION_EDGE_BENDS, PenaltySettings.OPTIMIZATION_EDGE_CROSSINGS, PenaltySettings.OPTIMIZATION_EDGE_LENGTHS, setPenaltySettings(PenaltySettings)

      • setMinimumEdgeToEdgeDistance

        Sets the minimum distance between a pair of edges.

        The minimum distance should be greater than or equal to 0. If a negative value is given as input, the default value, i.e., 3.0, will be used instead.

        Default Value:
        The default value is 3.0.
        Parameters:

        See Also:
        getMinimumEdgeToEdgeDistance()

        public void setMonotonicPathRestriction(MonotonicPathRestriction value)
        Sets the monotonic path restrictions that should be applied.

        Monotonic path restrictions imply that (ideally) the vertical and/or horizontal segments of an edge path are directed from the source node towards the target node without ever changing their direction back towards the source node.

        If an unknown restriction is specified, MonotonicPathRestriction.NONE will be used instead.

        Default Value:
        The default value is MonotonicPathRestriction.NONE. No path restrictions are used.
        Parameters:
        value - one of the predefined monotonic path restrictions
        See Also:
        getMonotonicPathRestriction()

        public void setPenaltySettings(PenaltySettings value)
        Sets the PenaltySettings used for this edge.

        Besides specifying a completely customized setting, the user can choose between four predefined optimization strategies: PenaltySettings.OPTIMIZATION_BALANCED, PenaltySettings.OPTIMIZATION_EDGE_BENDS, PenaltySettings.OPTIMIZATION_EDGE_CROSSINGS and PenaltySettings.OPTIMIZATION_EDGE_LENGTHS.

        Throws:
